description: From Latin infundibulum (“funnel”), and the Latin forma (“shape, likeness”).

adjectives.description: infundibuliform (comparative more infundibuliform, superlative most infundibuliform)

entries.meaning: having the shape of a funnel or cone.
examples: ... had it not been for that patriotic Texan with his infundibuliform jowls and his lumpy, rumpleheaded, indestructible smile cracked forever across the front of his face like the brim of a black ten-gallon hat.
